intro: Sloanea aberrans, commonly known as the red-leaf sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that often display a striking red or purple coloration on the underside. Sloanea aberrans produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
